title: Display sources in collapsible accordion instead of inline
description:
Currently, sources are displayed inline in the message text (e.g., '[Source: PA-DHS-Long-Term-Care.md]').

**Proposed enhancement:**
- Add a collapsible 'Sources' accordion at the end of each AI response
- Show source documents with clickable links
- Collapse by default to keep UI clean
- Match the design shown in AI Elements components

This improves readability and makes sources easier to access/verify.
close_reason: Updated extractSources to parse inline [Source: filename] citations - sources accordion now populates from text

title: Add mental health crisis resources for emotional queries
description:
When users mention emotional distress (e.g., 'I'm feeling depressed about bills'), the AI should include mental health crisis resources.

**Current behavior:** Provides empathetic response with financial resources
**Enhancement:** Also include crisis support information

**Proposed additions:**
- 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline (call or text 988)
- Link to local mental health resources
- Gentle reminder that professional support is available

This ensures users in distress have access to appropriate mental health support alongside financial guidance.
close_reason: Added EMOTIONAL DISTRESS section to agent instructions with 988 crisis line

title: Add professional referral disclaimers for sensitive topics
description:
When answering sensitive questions (estate planning, legal matters, financial decisions), the AI should include appropriate disclaimers and referrals to professionals.

**Examples of sensitive topics:**
- Estate recovery / 'What happens to my house when I die?'
- Legal eligibility questions
- Complex financial planning

**Proposed solution:**
Add a disclaimer like: 'This information is for general guidance only. Please consult with an estate attorney or financial advisor for advice specific to your situation.'

This protects users and ensures they seek proper professional guidance for important decisions.
close_reason: Added SENSITIVE TOPICS section to agent instructions with professional referral disclaimer

title: Switch to Gemini 2.0 Flash model
description: Change default model from GLM 4.5 Air to google/gemini-2.0-flash-001. Gemini supports tool calling required for RAG agent without rate limiting issues.
close_reason: Closed

title: Add visual feedback to Copy button
description:
The Copy button on messages doesn't provide visual feedback when clicked.

**Current behavior:** Button stays as 'Copy' after clicking
**Expected behavior:** Button should change to 'Copied!' temporarily (1-2 seconds) to confirm the action

This is a common UX pattern that helps users know their action succeeded.
close_reason: Added visual feedback - shows CheckIcon and 'Copied\!' for 2 seconds after clicking

title: Model comparison: Gemini 2.0 Flash vs Grok 4.1 Fast
description: Create test script to compare google/gemini-2.0-flash-001 and x-ai/grok-4.1-fast. Compare: response latency (TTFT, total time), tool calling reliability, response quality, streaming behavior, token usage/cost. Document findings with recommendations
close_reason: Created comparison script and ran tests. Results: Grok has faster TTFB (1.5s vs 17s) but slower total time due to longer responses. Both have 100% tool calling success. Documented findings in scripts/model-comparison-results.md

title: Improve suggested questions visibility in empty state
description:
Suggested questions are positioned below the fold and require scrolling to see them.

**Current behavior:**
- Empty state shows welcome message at top
- Suggested questions (What is PACE?, Am I eligible?, etc.) require scroll to view

**Proposed enhancement:**
- Ensure suggested questions are visible without scrolling on most screen sizes
- Consider placing them above the input area or adjusting layout

This improves discoverability and helps new users understand what questions to ask.
close_reason: Reduced spacing in empty state - smaller icon, tighter header spacing, compact buttons

title: BUG: Repetitive 'Let me search' text in responses
description:
When asking sensitive queries (e.g., 'What happens to my house when I die?'), the response shows repetitive text like 'Let me search for more specific information...' appearing 3+ times before the actual answer.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Ask 'What happens to my house when I die?'
2. Observe the response

**Expected:** Single search statement followed by answer
**Actual:** Search statement repeats multiple times

This appears to be a streaming/chunking issue with the AI response.
close_reason: Fixed by disabling sendReasoning in stream to prevent repetitive model thinking from appearing in output

title: Fix spacing between file upload and model selector in prompt input
description: Add file button and model selector are running together without gap. Need to add proper spacing in PromptInputTools.
close_reason: Fixed: increased gap from gap-1 to gap-3 in PromptInputTools
